intro: Majidea cyanosperma, commonly known as the blue-flowered rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and features small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has basal leaves that are typically oval or lance-shaped, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Majidea cyanosperma is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar floral structures. It is often found in alpine environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal in rock gardens.
